   19: %%
   20: -module(proc_lib_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %%
   23: %% Define to run outside of test server
   24: %%
   25: %%-define(STANDALONE,1).
   26: 
   27: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   28: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, 
   29: 	 crash/1, stacktrace/1, sync_start_nolink/1, sync_start_link/1,
   30:          sync_start_monitor/1, sync_start_monitor_link/1,
   31:          sync_start_timeout/1, sync_start_link_timeout/1,
   32:          sync_start_monitor_link_timeout/1,
   33:          spawn_opt/1, sp1/0, sp1_with_label/0, sp2/0, sp3/1, sp4/2,
   34:          sp5/1, sp6/1, sp7/1, sp8/1, sp9/1, sp10/1,
   35:          '\x{447}'/0, hibernate/1, stop/1, t_format/1, t_format_arbitrary/1]).
   36: -export([ otp_6345/1, init_dont_hang/1]).
   37: 
   38: -export([hib_loop/1, awaken/1]).
   39: 
   40: -export([init/1,
   41: 	 handle_event/2, handle_call/2, handle_info/2,
   42: 	 terminate/2]).
   43: 
   44: -export([otp_6345_init/1, init_dont_hang_init/1]).
   45: 
   46: -export([report_cb/1, report_cb_chars_limit/1, log/2, rcb_tester/0]).
   47: 
   48: -export([system_terminate/4]).
   49: 
   50: -ifdef(STANDALONE).
   51: -define(line, noop, ).
   52: -else.
   53: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   54: -endif.
   55: 
   56: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   57: 
   58: all() -> 
   59:     [crash, stacktrace, {group, sync_start}, spawn_opt, hibernate,
   60:      {group, tickets}, stop, t_format, t_format_arbitrary, report_cb].
   61: 
   62: groups() -> 
   63:     [{tickets, [], [otp_6345, init_dont_hang]},
   64:      {sync_start, [], [sync_start_nolink, sync_start_link,
   65:                        sync_start_monitor, sync_start_monitor_link,
   66:                        sync_start_timeout, sync_start_link_timeout,
   67:                        sync_start_monitor_link_timeout]}].
   68: 
   69: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   70:     Config.
   71: 
   72: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   73:     ok.
   74: 
   75: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   76:     Config.
   77: 
   78: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   79:     Config.
   80: 
   81: 
   82: 
   83: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   84: %% We don't have to test that spwn and spawn_link actually spawns
   85: %% new processes - if they don't we can't run this suite!
   86: %% But we want to test that start and start_link really is
   87: %% synchronous, and we want to test that the crash report is ok.
   88: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   89: crash(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   90:     ok = application:unset_env(kernel, error_logger_format_depth),
   91:     crash_1(Config),
   92:     ok = application:set_env(kernel, error_logger_format_depth, 30),
   93:     crash_1(Config),
   94:     ok = application:unset_env(kernel, error_logger_format_depth),
   95:     ok.
   96: 
   97: crash_1(_Config) ->
   98:     error_logger:add_report_handler(?MODULE, self()),
   99: 
  100:     %% Make sure that we don't get a crash report if a process
  101:     %% terminates with reason 'shutdown' or reason {shutdown,Reason}.
  102:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  103:     Pid0 = proc_lib:spawn_link(erlang, apply,
  104: 			       [fun() -> exit(shutdown) end,[]]),
  105:     Pid1 = proc_lib:spawn_link(erlang, apply,
  106: 			       [fun() -> exit({shutdown,{a,b,c}}) end,[]]),
  107: 
  108:     receive {'EXIT',Pid0,shutdown} -> ok end,
  109:     receive {'EXIT',Pid1,{shutdown,{a,b,c}}} -> ok end,
  110:     process_flag(trap_exit, false),
  111:     %% We expect any unexpected messages to be caught below,
  112:     %% so we don't have explicitly wait some time to be sure.
  113: 
  114:     %% Spawn export function.
  115:     Pid2 = proc_lib:spawn(?MODULE, sp1, []),
  116:     Pid2 ! die,
  117:     Exp2 = [{initial_call,{?MODULE,sp1,[]}},
  118: 	    {ancestors,[self()]},
  119: 	    {error_info,{exit,die,{stacktrace}}}],
  120:     analyse_crash(Pid2, Exp2, []),
  121: 
  122:     %% Spawn fun.
  123:     F = fun sp1/0,
  124:     Pid3 = proc_lib:spawn(node(), F),
  125:     Pid3 ! die,
  126:     {module,?MODULE} = erlang:fun_info(F, module),
  127:     {name,Fname} = erlang:fun_info(F, name),
  128:     Exp3 = [{initial_call,{?MODULE,Fname,[]}},
  129: 	    {ancestors,[self()]},
  130: 	    {error_info,{exit,die,{stacktrace}}}],
  131:     analyse_crash(Pid3, Exp3, []),
  132: 
  133:     %% Spawn function with neighbour.
  134:     Pid4 = proc_lib:spawn(?MODULE, sp2, []),
  135:     ct:sleep(100),
  136:     {?MODULE,sp2,[]} = proc_lib:initial_call(Pid4),
  137:     {?MODULE,sp2,0} = proc_lib:translate_initial_call(Pid4),
  138:     {test, sp2} = proc_lib:get_label(Pid4),
  139:     %% Check this, if changed fix c.erl and runtime_tools
  140:     %% which uses the 'internal' dictionary name as an optimization.
  141:     {_, {test, sp2}} = process_info(Pid4, {dictionary, '$process_label'}),
  142: 
  143:     Pid4 ! die,
  144:     Exp4 = [{initial_call,{?MODULE,sp2,[]}},
  145:             {process_label, {test, sp2}},
  146: 	    {ancestors,[self()]},
  147: 	    {error_info,{exit,die,{stacktrace}}}],
  148:     Links4 = [[{initial_call,{?MODULE,sp1_with_label,[]}},
  149:                {process_label, {test, sp1_with_label}},
  150: 	       {ancestors,[Pid4,self()]}]],
  151:     analyse_crash(Pid4, Exp4, Links4),
  152: 
  153:     %% Make sure that we still get a crash report if the
  154:     %% process dictionary have been tampered with.
  155: 
  156:     Pid5 = proc_lib:spawn(erlang, apply,
  157: 			  [fun() ->
  158: 				   erase(),
  159: 				   exit(abnormal)
  160: 			   end,[]]),
  161:     Exp5 = [{initial_call,absent},
  162: 	    {ancestors,[]},
  163: 	    {error_info,{exit,abnormal,{stacktrace}}}],
  164:     analyse_crash(Pid5, Exp5, []),
  165: 
  166:     %% Unicode atom
  167:     Pid6 = proc_lib:spawn(?MODULE, '\x{447}', []),
  168:     Pid6 ! die,
  169:     Exp6 = [{initial_call,{?MODULE,'\x{447}',[]}},
  170: 	    {ancestors,[self()]},
  171: 	    {error_info,{exit,die,{stacktrace}}}],
  172:     analyse_crash(Pid6, Exp6, []),
  173: 
  174:     error_logger:delete_report_handler(?MODULE),
  175:     ok.
  176: 
  177: analyse_crash(Pid, Expected0, ExpLinks) ->
  178:     Expected = [{pid,Pid}|Expected0],
  179:     receive
  180: 	{crash_report, Pid, Report} ->
  181: 	    _ = proc_lib:format(Report),	%Smoke test.
  182: 	    [Crash,Links] = Report,
  183: 	    analyse_crash_1(Expected, Crash),
  184: 	    analyse_links(ExpLinks, Links);
  185: 	Unexpected ->
  186: 	    io:format("~p\n", [Unexpected]),
  187: 	    ct:fail(unexpected_message)
  188:     after 5000 ->
  189: 	    ct:fail(no_crash_report)
  190:     end.
  191: 
  192: analyse_links([H|Es], [{neighbour,N}|Links]) ->
  193:     analyse_crash_1(H, N),
  194:     analyse_links(Es, Links);
  195: analyse_links([], []) ->
  196:     ok.
  197: 
  198: analyse_crash_1([{Key,absent}|T], Report) ->
  199:     false = lists:keymember(Key, 1, Report),
  200:     analyse_crash_1(T, Report);
  201: analyse_crash_1([{Key,Pattern}|T], Report) ->
  202:     case lists:keyfind(Key, 1, Report) of
  203: 	false ->
  204: 	    io:format("~p", [Report]),
  205: 	    ct:fail({missing_key,Key});
  206: 	{Key,Info} ->
  207: 	    try
  208: 		match_info(Pattern, Info)
  209: 	    catch
  210: 		no_match ->
  211: 		    io:format("key: ~p", [Key]),
  212: 		    io:format("pattern: ~p", [Pattern]),
  213: 		    io:format("actual: ~p", [Report]),
  214: 		    ct:fail(no_match)
  215: 	    end,
  216: 	    analyse_crash_1(T, Report)
  217:     end;
  218: analyse_crash_1([], _Report) ->
  219:     [].
  220: 
  221: match_info(T, T) ->
  222:     ok;
  223: match_info({stacktrace}, Stk) when is_list(Stk) ->
  224:     ok;
  225: match_info([H1|T1], [H2|T2]) ->
  226:     match_info(H1, H2),
  227:     match_info(T1, T2);
  228: match_info(Tuple1, Tuple2) when tuple_size(Tuple1) =:= tuple_size(Tuple2) ->
  229:     match_info(tuple_to_list(Tuple1), tuple_to_list(Tuple2));
  230: match_info(_, _) ->
  231:     throw(no_match).
  232: 
  233: stacktrace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  234:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  235:     %% Errors.
  236:     Pid1 = proc_lib:spawn_link(fun() -> 1 = 2 end),
  237:     receive
  238: 	{'EXIT',Pid1,{{badmatch,2},_Stack1}} -> ok
  239:     after 500 ->
  240: 	ct:fail(error)
  241:     end,
  242:     %% Exits.
  243:     Pid2 = proc_lib:spawn_link(fun() -> exit(bye) end),
  244:     receive
  245: 	{'EXIT',Pid2,bye} -> ok
  246:     after 500 ->
  247: 	ct:fail(exit)
  248:     end,
  249:     %% Throws.
  250:     Pid3 = proc_lib:spawn_link(fun() -> throw(ball) end),
  251:     receive
  252: 	{'EXIT',Pid3,{{nocatch,ball},_Stack3}} -> ok
  253:     after 500 ->
  254: 	ct:fail(throw)
  255:     end,
  256:     ok.
  257: 
  258: sync_start_nolink(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  259:     _Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, sp5, [self()]),
  260:     receive
  261: 	{sync_started, F} -> 
  262: 	    exit(F, kill),
  263: 	    ct:fail(async_start)
  264:     after 1000 -> ok
  265:     end,
  266:     receive
  267: 	{Pid2, init} ->
  268: 	    Pid2 ! go_on
  269:     end,
  270:     receive
  271: 	{sync_started, _} -> ok
  272:     after 1000 ->
  273: 	    exit(Pid2, kill),
  274: 	    ct:fail(no_sync_start)
  275:     end,
  276:     ok.
  277: 
  278: sync_start_link(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  279:     _Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, sp3, [self()]),
  280:     receive
  281: 	{sync_started, _} -> ct:fail(async_start)
  282:     after 1000 -> ok
  283:     end,
  284:     receive
  285: 	{Pid2, init} ->
  286: 	    Pid2 ! go_on
  287:     end,
  288:     receive
  289: 	{sync_started, _} -> ok
  290:     after 1000 -> ct:fail(no_sync_start)
  291:     end,
  292:     ok.
  293: 
  294: sync_start_monitor(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  295:     _Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, sp6, [self()]),
  296:     receive
  297: 	{sync_started, _} -> ct:fail(async_start)
  298:     after 1000 -> ok
  299:     end,
  300:     receive
  301: 	{Pid2, init} ->
  302: 	    Pid2 ! go_on
  303:     end,
  304:     receive
  305: 	{sync_started, _} -> ok
  306:     after 1000 -> ct:fail(no_sync_start)
  307:     end,
  308:     receive received_down -> ok
  309:     after 2000 -> ct:fail(no_down)
  310:     end,
  311:     ok.
  312: 
  313: sync_start_monitor_link(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  314:     _Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, sp7, [self()]),
  315:     receive
  316: 	{sync_started, _} -> ct:fail(async_start)
  317:     after 1000 -> ok
  318:     end,
  319:     receive
  320: 	{Pid2, init} ->
  321: 	    Pid2 ! go_on
  322:     end,
  323:     receive
  324: 	{sync_started, _} -> ok
  325:     after 1000 -> ct:fail(no_sync_start)
  326:     end,
  327:     receive received_down -> ok
  328:     after 1000 -> ct:fail(no_down)
  329:     end,
  330:     receive received_exit -> ok
  331:     after 1000 -> ct:fail(no_exit)
  332:     end,
  333:     ok.
  334: 
  335: sync_start_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  336:     _Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, sp8, [self()]),
  337:     receive done -> ok end,
  338:     receive {received_exit, _} = M1 -> ct:fail(M1)
  339:     after 0 -> ok
  340:     end,
  341:     receive {received_down, _} = M2 -> ct:fail(M2)
  342:     after 0 -> ok
  343:     end,
  344:     ok.
  345: 
  346: sync_start_link_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  347:     _Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, sp9, [self()]),
  348:     receive done -> ok end,
  349:     receive {received_exit, _} = M1 -> ct:fail(M1)
  350:     after 0 -> ok
  351:     end,
  352:     receive {received_down, _} = M2 -> ct:fail(M2)
  353:     after 0 -> ok
  354:     end,
  355:     ok.
  356:     
  357: sync_start_monitor_link_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  358:     _Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, sp10, [self()]),
  359:     receive done -> ok end,
  360:     receive {received_exit, _} = M1 -> ct:fail(M1)
  361:     after 0 -> ok
  362:     end,
  363:     receive
  364:         {received_down, R} ->
  365:             killed = R,
  366:             ok
  367:     after 0 -> ct:fail(no_down)
  368:     end,
  369:     ok.
  370:     
  371: 
  372: spawn_opt(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  373:     F = fun sp1/0,
  374:     {name,Fname} = erlang:fun_info(F, name),
  375:     FunMFArgs = {?MODULE,Fname,[]},
  376:     FunMFArity = {?MODULE,Fname,0},
  377:     Pid1 = proc_lib:spawn_opt(node(), F, [{priority,low}]),
  378:     Pid = proc_lib:spawn_opt(F, [{priority,low}]),
  379:     ct:sleep(100),
  380:     FunMFArgs = proc_lib:initial_call(Pid),
  381:     FunMFArity = proc_lib:translate_initial_call(Pid),
  382:     Pid ! die,
  383:     FunMFArgs = proc_lib:initial_call(Pid1),
  384:     FunMFArity = proc_lib:translate_initial_call(Pid1),
  385:     Pid1 ! die,
  386:     ok.
  387: 
  388: 
  389: sp1() ->
  390:     receive
  391: 	die -> exit(die);
  392: 	_ -> sp1()
  393:     end.
  394: 
  395: sp1_with_label() ->
  396:     ok = proc_lib:set_label({test, ?FUNCTION_NAME}),
  397:     sp1().
  398: 
  399: sp2() ->
  400:     ok = proc_lib:set_label({test, ?FUNCTION_NAME}),
  401:     {test, ?FUNCTION_NAME} = proc_lib:get_label(self()),
  402: 
  403:     _Pid = proc_lib:spawn_link(?MODULE, sp1_with_label, []),
  404:     receive 
  405: 	die -> exit(die);
  406: 	_ -> sp1()
  407:     end.
  408: 
  409: sp3(Tester) ->
  410:     Pid = proc_lib:start_link(?MODULE, sp4, [self(), Tester]),
  411:     Tester ! {sync_started, Pid}.
  412: 
  413: sp5(Tester) ->
  414:     Pid = proc_lib:start(?MODULE, sp4, [self(), Tester]),
  415:     Tester ! {sync_started, Pid}.
  416: 
  417: sp6(Tester) ->
  418:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  419:     {Pid, Mon} = proc_lib:start_monitor(?MODULE, sp4, [self(), Tester]),
  420:     Tester ! {sync_started, Pid},
  421:     receive
  422:         {'EXIT', Pid, normal} ->
  423:             exit(received_exit)
  424:     after 1000 ->
  425:             ok
  426:     end,
  427:     receive
  428:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, normal} ->
  429:             Tester ! received_down
  430:     end.
  431: 
  432: sp7(Tester) ->
  433:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  434:     {Pid, Mon} = proc_lib:start_monitor(?MODULE, sp4, [self(), Tester], infinity, [link]),
  435:     Tester ! {sync_started, Pid},
  436:     receive
  437:         {'EXIT', Pid, normal} ->
  438:             Tester ! received_exit
  439:     end,
  440:     receive
  441:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, normal} ->
  442:             Tester ! received_down
  443:     end.
  444: 
  445: sp8(Tester) ->
  446:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  447:     {error,timeout} = proc_lib:start(?MODULE, sp4, [self(), Tester], 500, [link]),
  448:     receive after 500 -> ok end,
  449:     receive
  450:         {'EXIT', _Pid1, Reason1} ->
  451:             Tester ! {received_exit, Reason1}
  452:     after 0 ->
  453:             ok
  454:     end,
  455:     receive
  456:         {'DOWN', _Mon2, process, _Pid2, Reason2} ->
  457:             Tester ! {received_down, Reason2}
  458:     after 0 ->
  459:             ok
  460:     end,
  461:     Tester ! done.
  462: 
  463: sp9(Tester) ->
  464:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  465:     {error,timeout} = proc_lib:start_link(?MODULE, sp4, [self(), Tester], 500),
  466:     receive after 500 -> ok end,
  467:     receive
  468:         {'EXIT', _Pid1, Reason1} ->
  469:             Tester ! {received_exit, Reason1}
  470:     after 0 ->
  471:             ok
  472:     end,
  473:     receive
  474:         {'DOWN', _Mon, process, _Pid2, Reason2} ->
  475:             Tester ! {received_down, Reason2}
  476:     after 0 ->
  477:             ok
  478:     end,
  479:     Tester ! done.
  480:     
  481: 
  482: sp10(Tester) ->
  483:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  484:     {{error,timeout}, Mon} = proc_lib:start_monitor(?MODULE, sp4, [self(), Tester], 500, [link]),
  485:     receive after 500 -> ok end,
  486:     receive
  487:         {'EXIT', _Pid1, Reason1} ->
  488:             Tester ! {received_exit, Reason1}
  489:     after 0 ->
  490:             ok
  491:     end,
  492:     receive
  493:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, _Pid2, Reason2} ->
  494:             Tester ! {received_down, Reason2}
  495:     after 0 ->
  496:             ok
  497:     end,
  498:     Tester ! done.
  499: 
  500: sp4(Parent, Tester) ->
  501:     Tester ! {self(), init},
  502:     receive
  503: 	go_on -> ok
  504:     end,
  505:     proc_lib:init_ack(Parent, self()).
  506: 
  507: '\x{447}'() ->
  508:     receive
  509: 	die -> exit(die);
  510: 	_ -> sp1()
  511:     end.
  512: 
  513: hibernate(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  514:     Ref = make_ref(),
  515:     Self = self(),
  516:     LoopData = {Ref,Self},
  517:     Pid = proc_lib:spawn_link(?MODULE, hib_loop, [LoopData]),
  518: 
  519:     %% Just check that the child process can process and answer messages.
  520:     Pid ! {Self,loop_data},
  521:     receive
  522: 	{loop_data,LoopData} -> ok;
  523: 	Unexpected0 ->
  524: 	    io:format("Unexpected: ~p\n", [Unexpected0]),
  525: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  526:     after 1000 ->
  527: 	    io:format("Timeout"),
  528: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  529:     end,
  530: 
  531:     %% Hibernate the process.
  532:     Pid ! hibernate,
  533:     erlang:yield(),
  534:     io:format("~p\n", [process_info(Pid, heap_size)]),
  535: 
  536: 
  537:     %% Send a message to the process...
  538: 
  539:     Pid ! {Self,loop_data},
  540: 
  541:     %% ... expect first a wake up message from the process...
  542:     receive
  543: 	{awaken,LoopData} -> ok;
  544: 	Unexpected1 ->
  545: 	    io:format("Unexpected: ~p\n", [Unexpected1]),
  546: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  547:     after 1000 ->
  548: 	    io:format("Timeout"),
  549: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  550:     end,
  551: 
  552:     %% ... followed by the answer to the actual request.
  553:     receive
  554: 	{loop_data,LoopData} -> ok;
  555: 	Unexpected2 ->
  556: 	    io:format("Unexpected: ~p\n", [Unexpected2]),
  557: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  558:     after 1000 ->
  559: 	    io:format("Timeout"),
  560: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  561:     end,
  562: 
  563:     %% Test that errors are handled correctly after wake up from hibernation...
  564: 
  565:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  566:     error_logger:add_report_handler(?MODULE, self()),
  567:     Pid ! crash,
  568: 
  569:     %% We should receive two messages. Especially in the SMP emulator,
  570:     %% we can't be sure of the message order, so sort the messages before
  571:     %% matching.
  572: 
  573:     Messages = lists:sort(hib_receive_messages(2)),
  574:     io:format("~p", [Messages]),
  575:     [{'EXIT',Pid,i_crashed},{crash_report,Pid,[Report,[]]}] = Messages,
  576: 
  577:     %% Check that the initial_call has the expected format.
  578:     {value,{initial_call,{?MODULE,hib_loop,[_]}}} =
  579: 	lists:keysearch(initial_call, 1, Report),
  580: 
  581:     error_logger:delete_report_handler(?MODULE),
  582:     ok.
  583: 
  584: hib_loop(LoopData) ->
  585:     receive
  586: 	hibernate ->
  587: 	    proc_lib:hibernate(?MODULE, awaken, [LoopData]);
  588: 	{Pid,loop_data} ->
  589: 	    Pid ! {loop_data,LoopData};
  590: 	crash ->
  591: 	    exit(i_crashed)
  592:     end,
  593:     hib_loop(LoopData).
  594: 
  595: awaken({_,Parent}=LoopData) ->
  596:     Parent ! {awaken,LoopData},
  597:     hib_loop(LoopData).
  598: 
  599: hib_receive_messages(0) -> [];
  600: hib_receive_messages(N) ->
  601:     receive
  602: 	Any -> [Any|hib_receive_messages(N-1)]
  603:     end.
  604: 
  605: %% 'monitor' spawn_opt option.
  606: otp_6345(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  607:     Opts = [link,monitor],
  608:     try
  609:         blupp = proc_lib:start(?MODULE, otp_6345_init, [self()],
  610:                                1000, Opts)
  611:     catch
  612:         error:badarg -> ok
  613:     end.
  614: 
  615: otp_6345_init(Parent) ->
  616:     proc_lib:init_ack(Parent, {ok, self()}),
  617:     otp_6345_loop().
  618: 
  619: otp_6345_loop() ->
  620:     receive
  621: 	_Msg ->
  622: 	    otp_6345_loop()
  623:     end.
  624: 
  625: %% OTP-9803. Check that proc_lib:start() doesn't hang if spawned process
  626: %% crashes before proc_lib:init_ack/2.
  627: init_dont_hang(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  628:     %% Start should behave as start_link
  629:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  630:     StartLinkRes = proc_lib:start_link(?MODULE, init_dont_hang_init, [self()]),
  631:     try
  632: 	StartLinkRes = proc_lib:start(?MODULE, init_dont_hang_init, [self()], 1000),
  633: 	StartLinkRes = proc_lib:start(?MODULE, init_dont_hang_init, [self()], 1000, []),
  634: 	ok
  635:     catch _:Error:Stacktrace ->
  636: 	    io:format("Error ~p /= ~p ~n",[Stacktrace, StartLinkRes]),
  637: 	    exit(Error)
  638:     end.
  639: 
  640: init_dont_hang_init(_Parent) ->
  641:     error(bad_init).
  642: 
  643: %% Test proc_lib:stop/1,3
  644: stop(_Config) ->
  645:     Parent = self(),
  646:     SysMsgProc =
  647: 	fun() ->
  648: 		receive
  649: 		    {system,From,Request} ->
  650: 			sys:handle_system_msg(Request,From,Parent,?MODULE,[],[])
  651: 		end
  652: 	end,
  653: 
  654:     %% Normal case:
  655:     %% Process handles system message and terminated with given reason
  656:     Pid1 = proc_lib:spawn(SysMsgProc),
  657:     ok = proc_lib:stop(Pid1),
  658:     false = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid1),
  659: 
  660:     %% Process does not exit
  661:     {'EXIT',noproc} = (catch proc_lib:stop(Pid1)),
  662: 
  663:     %% Badly handled system message
  664:     DieProc =
  665: 	fun() ->
  666: 		receive
  667: 		    {system,_From,_Request} ->
  668: 			exit(die)
  669: 		end
  670: 	end,
  671:     Pid2 = proc_lib:spawn(DieProc),
  672:     {'EXIT',{die,_}} = (catch proc_lib:stop(Pid2)),
  673: 
  674:     %% Hanging process => timeout
  675:     HangProc =
  676: 	fun() ->
  677: 		receive
  678: 		    {system,_From,_Request} ->
  679: 			timer:sleep(5000)
  680: 		end
  681: 	end,
  682:     Pid3 = proc_lib:spawn(HangProc),
  683:     {'EXIT',timeout} = (catch proc_lib:stop(Pid3,normal,1000)),
  684: 
  685:     %% Ensure that a termination message is always sent to the
  686:     %% target process and that it eventually terminates.
  687:     Pid4 = proc_lib:spawn(HangProc),
  688:     Ref4 = monitor(process, Pid4),
  689:     {'EXIT', timeout} = (catch proc_lib:stop(Pid4, normal, 0)),
  690:     ok = receive
  691: 	{'DOWN', Ref4, process, _, _} ->
  692: 	    ok;
  693: 	M -> M
  694:     after 6000 ->
  695: 	timeout
  696:     end,
  697: 
  698:     %% Ensure that if process stops with same reason just as stop is called,
  699:     %% stop does not throw an exception.
  700:     PidNormalStop = proc_lib:spawn(fun() -> timer:sleep(1000) end),
  701:     ok = proc_lib:stop(PidNormalStop,normal,2000),
  702:     false = erlang:is_process_alive(PidNormalStop),
  703:     PidDieStop = proc_lib:spawn(fun() -> timer:sleep(1000), exit(die) end),
  704:     ok = proc_lib:stop(PidDieStop,die,2000),
  705:     false = erlang:is_process_alive(PidDieStop),
  706:     PidDieStopCrash = proc_lib:spawn(fun() -> timer:sleep(1000), exit(die) end),
  707:     {'EXIT', {die, _}} = catch (proc_lib:stop(PidDieStopCrash,normal,2000)),
  708:     false = erlang:is_process_alive(PidDieStopCrash),
  709: 
  710:     %% Success case with other reason than 'normal'
  711:     Pid5 = proc_lib:spawn(SysMsgProc),
  712:     ok = proc_lib:stop(Pid5,other_reason,infinity),
  713:     false = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid5),
  714: 
  715:     %% System message is handled, but process dies with other reason
  716:     %% than the given (in system_terminate/4 below)
  717:     Pid6 = proc_lib:spawn(SysMsgProc),
  718:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,2},_Stacktrace}} = (catch proc_lib:stop(Pid6,crash,infinity)),
  719:     false = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid6),
  720: 
  721:     %% Local registered name
  722:     Pid7 = proc_lib:spawn(SysMsgProc),
  723:     register(to_stop,Pid7),
  724:     ok = proc_lib:stop(to_stop),
  725:     undefined = whereis(to_stop),
  726:     false = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid7),
  727: 
  728:     %% Remote registered name
  729:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  730:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  731:     rpc:call(Node,code,add_path,[Dir]),
  732:     Pid8 = spawn(Node,SysMsgProc),
  733:     true = rpc:call(Node,erlang,register,[to_stop,Pid8]),
  734:     Pid8 = rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[to_stop]),
  735:     ok = proc_lib:stop({to_stop,Node}),
  736:     undefined = rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[to_stop]),
  737:     false = rpc:call(Node,erlang,is_process_alive,[Pid8]),
  738: 
  739:     %% Local and remote registered name, but non-existing
  740:     {'EXIT',noproc} = (catch proc_lib:stop(to_stop)),
  741:     {'EXIT',noproc} = (catch proc_lib:stop({to_stop,Node})),
  742: 
  743:     peer:stop(Peer),
  744: 
  745:     %% Remote registered name, but non-existing node
  746:     {'EXIT',{{nodedown,Node},_}} = (catch proc_lib:stop({to_stop,Node})),
  747:     ok.
  748: 
  749: system_terminate(crash,_Parent,_Deb,_State) ->
  750:     error({badmatch,2});
  751: system_terminate(Reason,_Parent,_Deb,_State) ->
  752:     exit(Reason).
  753: 
  754: 
  755: t_format(_Config) ->
  756:     {ok,#{level:=Level}} = logger:get_handler_config(default),
  757:     logger:set_handler_config(default,level,none),
  758:     error_logger:add_report_handler(?MODULE, self()),
  759:     try
  760: 	t_format()
  761:     after
  762:         error_logger:delete_report_handler(?MODULE),
  763:         logger:set_handler_config(default,level,Level)
  764:     end,
  765:     ok.
  766: 
  767: t_format() ->
  768:     Pid = proc_lib:spawn(fun '\x{aaa}t_format_looper'/0),
  769:     HugeData = gb_sets:from_list(lists:seq(1, 100)),
  770:     SomeData1 = list_to_atom([246]),
  771:     SomeData2 = list_to_atom([1024]),
  772:     Pid ! {SomeData1,SomeData2},
  773:     Pid ! {die,{HugeData,SomeData1,SomeData2}},
  774:     Report = receive
  775: 		 {crash_report, Pid, Report0} -> Report0
  776: 	     end,
  777:     Usz = do_test_format(Report, latin1, unlimited),
  778:     Tsz = do_test_format(Report, latin1, 20),
  779: 
  780:     if
  781: 	Tsz >= Usz ->
  782: 	    ct:fail(failed);
  783: 	true ->
  784: 	    ok
  785:     end,
  786: 
  787:     UszU = do_test_format(Report, unicode, unlimited),
  788:     TszU = do_test_format(Report, unicode, 20),
  789: 
  790:     if
  791: 	TszU >= UszU ->
  792: 	    ct:fail(failed);
  793: 	true ->
  794: 	    ok
  795:     end,
  796: 
  797:     ok.
  798: 
  799: t_format_arbitrary(_Config) ->
  800:     {ok,#{level:=Level}} = logger:get_handler_config(default),
  801:     logger:set_handler_config(default,level,none),
  802:     try
  803:         t_format_arbitrary()
  804:     after
  805:         logger:set_handler_config(default,level,Level)
  806:     end,
  807:     ok.
  808: 
  809: t_format_arbitrary() ->
  810:     A = list_to_atom([1024]),
  811:     do_test_format([fake_report, A], unlimited),
  812:     do_test_format([fake_report, A], 20),
  813: 
  814:     do_test_format([fake_report, foo], unlimited),
  815:     do_test_format([fake_report, foo], 20),
  816:     do_test_format([fake_report, []], unlimited),
  817:     do_test_format([fake_report, []], 20).
  818: 
  819: do_test_format(Report, Depth) ->
  820:     do_test_format(Report, latin1, Depth),
  821:     do_test_format(Report, unicode, Depth).
  822: 
  823: do_test_format(Report, Encoding, Depth) ->
  824:     io:format("*** Depth = ~p, Encoding = ~p", [Depth, Encoding]),
  825:     S0 = proc_lib:format(Report, Encoding, Depth),
  826:     S = lists:flatten(S0),
  827:     case Encoding of
  828:         latin1 -> io:format("~s\n", [S]);
  829:         _ -> io:format("~ts\n", [S])
  830:     end,
  831:     length(S).
  832: 
  833: '\x{aaa}t_format_looper'() ->
  834:     receive
  835: 	{die,Data} ->
  836: 	    exit(Data);
  837: 	M ->
  838:             put(M, M),
  839: 	    '\x{aaa}t_format_looper'()
  840:     end.
  841: 
  842: %% Test report callback for any Logger handler
  843: report_cb(_Config) ->
  844:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,?MODULE,#{config=>self()}),
  845:     Pid = proc_lib:spawn(?MODULE, sp2, []),
  846:     ct:sleep(100),
  847:     {links,[NPid]} = process_info(Pid,links),
  848:     NPidStr = pid_to_list(NPid),
  849:     Pid ! die,
  850:     Report =
  851:         receive
  852:             {report,R} ->
  853:                 R
  854:         after 5000 ->
  855:                 ct:fail(no_report_received)
  856:         end,
  857: 
  858:     Str1 = flatten_report_cb(Report,#{}),
  859:     L1 = length(Str1),
  860:     Expected1 = "  crasher:\n    initial call: proc_lib_SUITE:sp2/0\n",
  861:     ct:log("Str1: ~p",[Str1]),
  862:     ct:log("length(Str1): ~p",[L1]),
  863:     true = lists:prefix(Expected1,Str1),
  864: 
  865:     FormatOpts1 = #{},
  866:     Str1 = flatten_report_cb(Report,FormatOpts1),
  867:     L1 = length(Str1),
  868:     Expected1 = "  crasher:\n    initial call: proc_lib_SUITE:sp2/0\n",
  869:     ct:log("Str1: ~p",[Str1]),
  870:     ct:log("length(Str1): ~p",[L1]),
  871:     true = lists:prefix(Expected1,Str1),
  872: 
  873:     Depth = 10,
  874:     FormatOpts2 = #{depth=>Depth},
  875:     Str2 = flatten_report_cb(Report,FormatOpts2),
  876:     L2 = length(Str2),
  877:     Expected2 = "  crasher:\n    initial call: proc_lib_SUITE:sp2/0\n",
  878:     ct:log("Str2: ~p",[Str2]),
  879:     ct:log("length(Str2): ~p",[L2]),
  880:     true = lists:prefix(Expected2,Str2),
  881:     true = L2<L1,
  882: 
  883:     FormatOpts3 = #{chars_limit=>500},
  884:     Str3 = flatten_report_cb(Report,FormatOpts3),
  885:     L3 = length(Str3),
  886:     Expected3 = "  crasher:\n    initial call: proc_lib_SUITE:sp2/0\n",
  887:     ct:log("Str3: ~p",[Str3]),
  888:     ct:log("length(Str3): ~p",[L3]),
  889:     true = lists:prefix(Expected3,Str3),
  890:     true = L3<L1,
  891: 
  892:     FormatOpts4 = #{single_line=>true},
  893:     Str4 = flatten_report_cb(Report,FormatOpts4),
  894:     L4 = length(Str4),
  895:     Expected4 = "crasher: initial call: proc_lib_SUITE:sp2/0,",
  896:     ct:log("Str4: ~p",[Str4]),
  897:     ct:log("length(Str4): ~p",[L4]),
  898:     true = lists:prefix(Expected4,Str4),
  899:     true = L4<L1,
  900: 
  901:     FormatOpts5 = #{single_line=>true, depth=>Depth},
  902:     Str5 = flatten_report_cb(Report,FormatOpts5),
  903:     L5 = length(Str5),
  904:     Expected5 = "crasher: initial call: proc_lib_SUITE:sp2/0,",
  905:     ct:log("Str5: ~p",[Str5]),
  906:     ct:log("length(Str5): ~p",[L5]),
  907:     true = lists:prefix(Expected5,Str5),
  908:     true = L5<L4,
  909:     %% Check that neighbour information is printed
  910:     SplitFun = fun($;) -> false; (_) -> true end,
  911:     ExpectedNeighbours5 = "; neighbours: neighbour: pid: "++NPidStr++
  912:         ", registered_name: []",
  913:     true = lists:prefix(ExpectedNeighbours5,lists:dropwhile(SplitFun, Str5)),
  914: 
  915:     FormatOpts6 = #{single_line=>true, chars_limit=>500},
  916:     Str6 = flatten_report_cb(Report,FormatOpts6),
  917:     L6 = length(Str6),
  918:     Expected6 = "crasher: initial call: proc_lib_SUITE:sp2/0,",
  919:     ct:log("Str6: ~p",[Str6]),
  920:     ct:log("length(Str6): ~p",[L6]),
  921:     true = lists:prefix(Expected6,Str6),
  922:     true = L6<L4,
  923:     %% Check that only pid is printed for neighbour, due to chars_limit
  924:     ExpectedNeighbours6 = "; neighbours: ["++NPidStr++"]",
  925:     ExpectedNeighbours6 = lists:dropwhile(SplitFun, Str6),
  926: 
  927:     ok = logger:remove_handler(?MODULE),
  928:     ok.
  929: 
  930: report_cb_chars_limit(_Config) ->
  931:     %% This test does not really test anything, it just formats the
  932:     %% crash reports with different settings and prints the result. It
  933:     %% could be used as an example if report_cb was to be modified
  934:     %% for better utilization of the available number of characters
  935:     %% according to the chars_limit setting.
  936:     %%
  937:     %% Currently, multi-line formatting with chars_limit=1024 gives
  938:     %% a final report of 1696 character. The excess is due to the fact
  939:     %% that io_lib_pretty counts non-white characters--the indentation
  940:     %% of the formatted exception is not counted.
  941:     %%
  942:     %% Single-line formatting with chars_limit=1024 gives a final
  943:     %% report of 1104 characters.
  944:     %%
  945:     %% Single-line formatting a fake report with chars_limit=1024 gives
  946:     %% a final report of 1024 characters.
  947: 
  948:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,?MODULE,#{config=>self()}),
  949:     Pid = proc_lib:spawn(?MODULE, rcb_tester, []),
  950:     ct:sleep(500),
  951:     Pid ! die,
  952:     Report =
  953:         receive
  954:             {report,R} ->
  955:                 R
  956:         after 5000 ->
  957:                 ct:fail(no_report_received)
  958:         end,
  959: 
  960:     ct:sleep(500), % To separate debug calls to erlang:display(), if any.
  961:     Str1 = flatten_report_cb(Report,#{}),
  962:     L1 = length(Str1),
  963:     ct:log("Multi-line, no size limit:~n~s",[Str1]),
  964:     ct:log("Length, multi-line, no size limit: ~p",[L1]),
  965: 
  966:     ct:sleep(500),
  967:     FormatOpts2 = #{chars_limit=>1024},
  968:     Str2 = flatten_report_cb(Report,FormatOpts2),
  969:     L2 = length(Str2),
  970:     ct:log("Multi-line, chars_limit=1024:~n~s",[Str2]),
  971:     ct:log("Length, multi-line, chars_limit=1024: ~p",[L2]),
  972: 
  973:     ct:sleep(500),
  974:     FormatOpts3 = #{single_line=>true, chars_limit=>1024},
  975:     Str3 = flatten_report_cb(Report,FormatOpts3),
  976:     L3 = length(Str3),
  977:     ct:log("Single-line, chars_limit=1024:~n~s",[Str3]),
  978:     ct:log("Length, single-line, chars_limit=1024: ~p",[L3]),
  979: 
  980:     ct:sleep(500),
  981:     Seq = lists:seq(1, 1000),
  982:     FakeReport = [[{fake_tag,Seq}],Seq],
  983:     FReport = #{label=>{proc_lib,crash}, report=>FakeReport},
  984:     Str4 = flatten_report_cb(FReport,FormatOpts3),
  985:     L4 = length(Str4),
  986:     ct:log("Fake: Single-line, chars_limit=1024:~n~s",[Str4]),
  987:     ct:log("Fake: Length, single-line, chars_limit=1024: ~p",[L4]),
  988: 
  989:     ok = logger:remove_handler(?MODULE),
  990:     ok.
  991: 
  992: rcb_tester() ->
  993:     L = lists:seq(1,255),
  994:     Term = [{some_data,#{pids=>processes(),
  995:                          info=>process_info(self())}},
  996:             {tabs,lists:sort(ets:all())},
  997:             {bin,list_to_binary(L)},
  998:             {list,L}],
  999: 
 1000:     %% Put something in process dictionary
 1001:     [put(K,V) ||{K,V} <- Term],
 1002: 
 1003:     %% Add some messages
 1004:     [self() ! {some_message,T} || T <- Term],
 1005: 
 1006:     %% Create some neighbours
 1007:     [_ = proc_lib:spawn_link(?MODULE,sp1,[]) || _ <- lists:seq(1,5)],
 1008: 
 1009:     receive
 1010: 	die -> error({badmatch,Term})
 1011:     end.
 1012: 
 1013: flatten_report_cb(Report, Format) ->
 1014:     lists:flatten(proc_lib:report_cb(Report, Format)).
 1015: 
 1016: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 1017: %% The error_logger handler used.
 1018: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 1019: init(Tester) ->
 1020:     {ok, Tester}.
 1021: 
 1022: handle_event({error_report, _GL, {Pid, crash_report, Report}}, Tester) ->
 1023:     io:format("~ts\n", [proc_lib:format(Report)]),
 1024:     Tester ! {crash_report, Pid, Report},
 1025:     {ok, Tester};
 1026: handle_event(_Event, State) ->
 1027:     {ok, State}.
 1028: 
 1029: handle_info(_, State) ->
 1030:     {ok, State}.
 1031: 
 1032: handle_call(_Query, State) -> {ok, {error, bad_query}, State}.
 1033: 
 1034: terminate(_Reason, State) ->
 1035:     State.
 1036: 
 1037: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 1038: %% The Logger handler used.
 1039: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 1040: log(#{msg:={report,Report}},#{config:=Pid}) ->
 1041:     Pid ! {report,Report};
 1042: log(_,_) ->
 1043:     ok.
